nodes.documentation:
@title ETH 2.0 -> ETH oracle
  * The goal of the oracle is to inform other parts of the system about balances controlled
by the DAO on the ETH 2.0 side. The balances can go up because of reward accumulation
and can go down because of slashing.
nodes.name: IDePoolOracle

nodes.documentation:
@notice Add `_member` to the oracle member committee
@param _member Address of a member to add
nodes.name: addOracleMember

nodes.documentation:
@notice Remove `_member` from the oracle member committee
@param _member Address of a member to remove
nodes.name: removeOracleMember

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns the current oracle member committee
nodes.name: getOracleMembers

nodes.documentation: @notice Set the number of oracle members required to form a data point to `_quorum`
nodes.name: setQuorum

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns the number of oracle members required to form a data point
nodes.name: getQuorum
getEpochDurationSeconds

nodes.documentation:
@notice Returns epoch id for a timestamp
@param _timestamp Unix timestamp, seconds
nodes.name: getEpochForTimestamp

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns current epoch id
nodes.name: getCurrentEpoch
pushData
getLatestData
